subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in Me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from Me you can do nothing. If anyone does not remain in Me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up and thrown into the fire and burned." (John 15:5, 6) NIV
reflection: To often " fruit bearing" is mistaken for merely soul winning but there is much more that is found in this term. In this chapter prayer, joy, and love are mentioned as fruit. there are other fruits mentioned in Galatians 5:22-24 and II Peter 1:5-8) "Remaining in Christ" means (1) believing that He is God's Son (I John 4:15), (2) receiving Him as Savior and Lord (John 1:12, (3) doing what God says (I John 3:24) (4) continuing to believe the Good News (I John 2:24, and (5) relating in love to the community of believers, Christ's body (John 15:12). Keep this list close at hand to see how you fare, and to see where you need improvement.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I often fall short in the "fruit bearing" part of my life and I ask your forgiveness for that. I also ask for an enlightening so that I may become more efficient in this area. I pray that I would be more sensitive and obedient to Your Holy Spirits leading. I also pray for Your hand of protection for our troops, comfort and sustain their families I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING YOU ALL!!!...(food for thought)...Jesus is a friend who walks in when
the world has walked out...
Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in Me
and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from Me you can do nothing. If
anyone does not remain in Me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and
withers; such branches are picked up and thrown into the fire and burned...
(Jn. 15:5, 6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

To often " fruit bearing" is mistaken for merely soul winning but there is much more
that is found in this term...

In this chapter prayer, joy, and love are mentioned as fruit. there are other fruits
mentioned in Gal. 5:22-24 and II Pet. 1:5-8)

"Remaining in Christ" means (1) believing that He is God's Son (I Jn. 4:15),
(2) receiving Him as Savior and Lord (Jn. 1:12, (3) doing what God says (I Jn 3:24)
(4) continuing to believe the Good News (I Jn. 2:24, and (5) relating in love to the 
community of believers, Christ's body (Jn. 15:12)...

Keep this list close at hand to see how you fare, and to see where you need 
improvement...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I often fall short in the "fruit bearing"
part of my life and I ask your forgiveness for that...I also ask for an enlightening
so that I may become more efficient in this area...I pray that I would be more 
sensitive and obedient to Your Holy Spirits leading...I also pray for Your hand of 
protection for our troops, comfort and sustain their families I pray in Jesus name...Amen

Keep looking up, for a special blessing today...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "If you remain in Me and My words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be given to you. This is to My Father's glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be My disciples." (John 15:7, 8) NIV
reflection: I often hear the statement, "I've been asking and asking how come I don't get what I want?" The key to answered prayer is in the beginning of vs. 7 "If you remain in Me and My words remain in you." What this is saying is, we need to keep our faith anchored in Christ and the cross, in doing so what ever we ask will be in accordance with God's will for us. When a vine produces "much fruit" God is glorified, for in the process each day He sends the sunshine and rain to make the crops grow, and constantly He nurtured each tiny plant and prepared it to blossom. What a moment of glory for the Lord of the harvest when it is brought into the barns, mature and ready for use! He made it all happen!!! This farming analogy shows how God is glorified when people come into a right relationship with Him and begin to "produce much fruit" in their lives.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that you even choose to have a relationship with such as I. I pray for a greater maturity so that I may produce much fruit. I pray again O Lord for Godly wisdom. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Those who deserve love the least
need it the most...

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says: "If you remain in Me and My words remain in you, ask whatever
you wish and it will be given to you. This is to My Father's glory, that you bear 
much fruit, showing yourselves to be My disciples...(Jn. 15:7, 8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

I often hear the statement, "I've been asking and asking how come I don't get 
what I want?"

The key to answered prayer is in the beginning of vs. 7 "If you remain in Me and
My words remain in you."

What this is saying is, we need to keep our faith anchored in Christ and the cross, in doing so
what ever we ask will be in accordance with God's will for us...

When a vine produces "much fruit" God is glorified, for in the process each day He 
sends the sunshine and rain to make the crops grow, and constantly He nurtured 
each tiny plant and prepared it to blossom.

What a moment of glory for the Lord of the harvest when it is brought into the barns,
mature and ready for use! He made it all happen!!!

This farming analogy shows how God is glorified when people come into a right
relationship with Him and begin to "produce much fruit" in their lives...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that you even choose to have 
a relationship with such as I...I pray for a greater maturity so that
I may produce much fruit...I pray again O Lord for Godly wisdom...Amen.

Keep looking up, for in Him we are made whole...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says, "As the Father has loved Me, so I have loved you. Now remain in My love. If you love Me remain in My love, just as I have obeyed My Father's commands and remain in His Love. I have told you this so that My joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete." (John 15:9-11) NIV
reflection: When things are going well, we feel elated. When hardship comes, we often sink into depression. But, true joy transcends rolling waves of circumstance. True joy comes from a consistent relationship with Jesus Christ. When our lives are intertwined with His, He will help us walk through adversity without sinking into those debilitating lows, and we will be able to manage prosperity without moving into deceptive highs. (In other words, our lives will remain on more of an even keel). The joy of living with Jesus Christ daily will keep us levelheaded, no matter how high or low our circumstances.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you, Lord, for being a part of my life. I pray that a relationship with You would become a reality in everyone's life. I pray that everyone would come to know the joy of your presence in their life. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Faith is daring the soul to go beyond
what the eyes can see...

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says, "As the Father has loved Me, so I have loved you. Now remain in My love.
If you love Me remain in My love, just as I have obeyed My Father's commands and
remain in His Love. I have told you this so that My joy may be in you and that your joy
may be complete...(Jn. 15:9-11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When things are going well, we feel elated. when hardship comes,
we often sink into depression...

But, true joy transcends rolling waves of circumstance. True joy comes from
a consistent relationship with Jesus Christ...

When our lives are intertwined with His, He will help us walk through adversity 
without sinking into those debilitating lows, and we will be able to manage 
prosperity without moving into deceptive highs...

(In other words, our lives will remain on more of an even keel).

The joy of living with Jesus Christ daily will keep us levelheaded, no matter how 
high or low our circumstances...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you Lord for being a part of my
life. I pray that a relationship with You would become a reality
in everyone's life. I pray that everyone would come to know the
joy of your presence in their life...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to be a part of your life...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: My command is this: love each other as I have loved you. Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends. (John 15:12, 13) NIV
reflection: Jesus Commands us to love each other has He has, and He loved us so much that He gave his life for us. We may not have to die for someone, but there are other ways to practice sacrificial love: like listening, helping, encouraging, and giving. Think of someone in particular who needs this kind of love today. Give all the love you can, and then try to give a little more.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I cannot thank You enough for Your love! Help me to always practice sacrificial love to those in need. Help me to have a sensitive heart for those who are in need, I pray this all in the name of Jesus. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The right angle to approach a difficult
problem is the "try-angle." (Lk. 1:37)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says: My command is this: love each other as I have loved you.
Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends...
(Jn. 15:12, 13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus Commands us to love each other has He has, and He loved us so 
much that He gave his life for us...

We may not have to die for someone, but there are other ways to practice 
sacrificial love: like listening, helping, encouraging, and giving...

Think of someone in particular who needs this kind of love today.
Give all the love you can, and then try to give a little more...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I cannot thank You enough for Your love!
Help me to always practice sacrificial love to those in need. Help
me to have a sensitive heart for those who are in need, I pray this 
all in the name of Jesus...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will help you solve your problems...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from My Father I have made known to you." (John 15:15) NIV
reflection: Because Jesus is Lord and Master, He should call us servants, instead, He calls us friends. How comforting and reassuring to be chosen as Christ's friends. Because He is Lord and Master, we owe Him our unqualified obedience, but most of all, Jesus asks us to obey Him because we love Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, how comforting it is to know that you consider me to be Your friend. I thank You for Your love O Lord. I pray that my love for you would shine in all that I do. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The Fellow who does things that count
doesn't usually stop to count them...(Phil. 4:13, 14)

Jesus says: "I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know
his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I
learned from My Father I have made known to you." (Jn. 15:15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Because Jesus is Lord and Master, He should call us servants, instead, He calls us friends.

How comforting and reassuring to be chosen as Christ's friends...Because He is Lord and 
Master, we owe Him our unqualified obedience, but most of all, Jesus asks us to obey Him 
because we love Him...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, how comforting it is to know that you consider me
to be Your friend...I thank You for Your love O Lord...I pray that my love for 
you would shine in all that I do...Amen.

Keep looking up, for I feel the Lord has a blessing for you today...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

I just want to say thanks from my brother for all
your prayers...He had 5 by-passes done and has 
even surprised the nurses and doctors as to all
that he is able to do within 24 hrs.

God bless you all!!!

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you, to go and bear fruit---fruit that will last. Then the Father will give you whatever you ask in My name." (John 15:16) NIV
reflection: Remember Jesus made the first choice---to love and to die for us, and to invite us to live with Him forever. It is up to us to make the second choice---to accept or reject the offer. Without His choice, we would have no choice to make. Remember there is no middle road.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I truly thank You for the sacrifice You made for me. I thank You for the invitation You made to give eternal life to all who have accepted You as Savior. I pray that there would be a real outpouring of Your Spirit upon the hearts of every believer, to bear fruit for You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...A critical spirit is like poison ivy---it only takes
a little contact to spread its poison...

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says: "You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you,
to go and bear fruit---fruit that will last. Then the Father will give you
whatever you ask in My name..." (Jn. 15:16) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Remember Jesus made the first choice---to love and to die for us,
and to invite us to live with Him forever...

It is up to us to make the second choice---to accept or reject the offer...

Without His choice, we would have no choice to make...

Remember there is no middle road...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I truly thank You for the sacrifice You made for me.
I thank You for the invitation You made to give eternal life to all who have
accepted You as Savior...I pray that there would be a real out-pouring of
Your Spirit upon the hearts of every believer, to bear fruit for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, there is an open door to all who accept Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "This is My command: love each other." (John 15:17) NIV
reflection: As we are seeing today, Christians are getting plenty of hatred from the world. So we need to support and love each other. Now the question is, do you allow small problems to get in the way of loving other believers??? Jesus commands that we love one another, and he will give us the strength to do it.
prayer: Dear Lord, there is so much hatred in the world today, I pray for added strength to love as I should. I also pray that you would help me to be more lovable. Help me to remain faithful to Your command, I pray in Jesus name Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Laziness and poverty are cousins. (Pro. 24:33, 34)

Jesus says: "This is My command: love each other." (Jn. 15:17) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

As we are seeing today, Christians are getting plenty of hatred from the world...

So we need to support and love each other...Now the question is, do you allow
small problems to get in the way of loving other believers???

Jesus commands that we love one another, and he will give us the strength to do it...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, there is so much hatred in the world today, I pray for
added strength to love as I should. I also pray that you would 
help me to be more loveable...Help me to remain faithful to Your 
command, I pray in Jesus name Amen...

Keep looking up, He will strengthen you for the tasks at hand...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says: "If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin. Now, however, they have no excuse for their sin. He who hates Me hates My Father as well. If I had not done among them what no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen these miracles, and yet they have hated both Me and My Father. But this is written in their Law; They hated Me without reason". (John 15:22-25) NIV
reflection: The greatest sin we can commit is to reject Christ. When Jesus says "they have no excuse," He is referring to the work of the cross. When we think about His sacrifice for us, rejecting him is unforgivable. Jesus' Teaching, Preaching, and Miracles all plainly reveal Who He was, but yet much of the world rejects Him and also hates the Christian. It is pretty plain to see by what is happening in the Moslem countries.
prayer: Dear Lord, I'm so thankful that I have a loving God, I am so thankful that You call all who love You, Your child. I pray that one day there will be no more hatred in the world. I pray that all men will be able to live side by side in love. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...If you have to tell people how good you are
you're probably not that good...

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says: "If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin.
Now, however, they have no excuse for their sin...

He who hates Me hates My Father as well...If I had not done among them what no 
one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen these miracles,
and yet they have hated both Me and My Father.

But this is written in their Law; 'They hated Me without reason...(Jn. 15:22-25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The greatest sin we can commit is to reject Christ...When Jesus says "they have 
no excuse," He is referring to the work of the cross...When we think about His 
sacrifice for us, rejecting him is unforgivable...

Jesus' Teaching, Preaching, and Miracles all plainly reveal Who He was, but
yet much of the world rejects Him and also hates the Christian...

It is pretty plain to see by what is happening in the Moslem countries...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, I'm so thankful that I have a loving God, I am so thankful that
You call all who love You, Your child...I pray that one day there will be no
more hatred in the world...I pray that all men will be able to live side by
side in love...Amen.

Keep looking up, you will not find a more loyal friend...
You're in the Prayers of Two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says, "When the Counselor comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father, He will testify about Me. And you also must testify, for you have been with Me from the beginning." (John 15:26, 27) NIV
reflection: Once again Jesus offers hope. The Holy Spirit gives strength to endure the unreasonable hatred and evil in our world and the hostility many have toward Christ. This is especially comforting for those facing persecution. Jesus uses two names for the Holy Spirit, "Counselor" and "Spirit of Truth." The word Counselor conveys the helping, encouraging, and strengthening work of the Spirit. Spirit of Truth, points to the teaching, illuminating, and reminding work of the Spirit. The Holy Spirit ministers to both the head and the heart, and both are every important.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for Your Spirit's presence, as teacher and comforter. I pray that I would be sensitive and obedient to His encouraging presence. And Lord for Your hand of protection for our troops today, bless and protect their families as they take care of matters here at home. I pray too for our countries leaders, both federal, state, and local. May they seek wisdom from You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Language is the expression of thought.
Every time you speak, your mind is on parade...

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says, "When the Counselor comes, whom I will send to you from
the Father, the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father, He will testify
about Me. And you also must testify, for you have been with Me from
the beginning." (Jn 15:26, 27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Once again Jesus offers hope...The Holy Spirit gives strength to endure the
unreasonable hatred and evil in our world and the hostility many have toward
Christ... This is especially comforting for those facing persecution...

Jesus uses two names for the Holy Spirit, "Counselor" and "Spirit of Truth."

The word Counselor conveys the helping, encouraging, and strengthening work
of the Spirit.

Spirit of Truth, points to the teaching, illuminating, and reminding work of the Spirit.

The Holy Spirit ministers to both the head and the heart, and both are every important...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for Your Spirit's presence, as teacher and comforter.
I pray that I would be sensitive and obedient to His encouraging presence...

I pray Lord for Your hand of protection for our troops today, bless and protect their families
as they take care of matters here at home...

I pray too for our countries leaders, both federal, state, and local. May they seek wisdom 
from You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He gives wisdom to all who ask...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says, "All this I have told you so you won't go astray. They will put you out of the synagogue, in fact a time is coming when anyone who kills you will think he is offering a service to God." (John 16:1, 2) NIV
reflection: In Jesus last moments with His disciple he warns them, (1) about further persecution. (2) He told them where, when, and why He was going away. (3) He assured them that they would not be left alone, but the Spirit would come. Jesus knew what lay ahead, and He did not want the disciples' faith shaken or destroyed. God wants you to know that you are not alone. You have the Holy Spirit to comfort you, teach you truth, and help you.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, What You said about persecution is now taking place not only in places like Iraq and other countries, but we also see You being put out of our schools, and other public places. I pray that once again You would be accepted everywhere. And that a revival in this country would take place. Amen.
original_content:
Good Morning!!!...(food for thought)...Take care of your character and your
reputation will take care of itself...(I Tim 4:8)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says, "All this I have told you so you won't go astray...They will put
you out of the synagogue, in fact a time is coming when anyone who kills
you will think he is offering a service to God...(Jn. 16:1,2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

In Jesus last moments with His disciple he warns them, (1) about further persecution.
(2) He told them where, when. and why He was going away. (3) He assured them that 
they would not be left alone, but the Spirit would come...

Jesus knew what lay ahead, and He did not want the disciples' faith shaken or destroyed.

God wants you to know that you are not alone. You have the Holy Spirit to comfort you,
teach you truth, and help you...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, What You said about persecution is now taking place
not only in places like Iraq and other countries, but we also see You being
put out of our schools, and other public places...I pray that once again You 
would be accepted everywhere...And that a revival in this country would take
place...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to speak with you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus had just told the disciples about the coming persecution and His going away, then He says, "Because I have said these things, you are filled with grief. But I tell you the truth: It is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away the Counselor will not come to you; but if I go, I will send Him to you." (John 16:6, 7) NIV
reflection: Unless Jesus did what He came to do, there would be no Good News. If He did not die, He could not remove our sins; He could not rise again and defeat death. If He did not go back to the Father, the Holy Spirit would not come, Christ's presence on earth was limited to one place at a time. His leaving meant He could be present to the whole world through the Holy Spirit.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for what Your finished work on the cross means to each and every believer. I thank You for the workings of the Holy Spirit. I pray for the Holy Spirit's guidance to make me a better witness. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The hardest secret for a man to keep
is his opinion of himself...(Ro. 12:3)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus had just told the disciples about the coming persecution and His going away,
then He says, "Because I have said these things, you are filled with grief. But I tell 
you the truth: It is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away the Counselor 
will not come to you; but if I go, I will send Him to you." (Jn. 16:6, 7) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Unless Jesus did what He came to do, there would be no Good News. If He did not die,
He could not remove our sins; He could not rise again and defeat death.

If He did not go back to the Father, the Holy Spirit would not come, Christ's presence on 
earth was limited to one place at a time. His leaving meant He could be present to the
whole world through the Holy Spirit.

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, I thank you for what Your finished work on the cross 
means to each and every believer...I thank You for the workings
of the Holy Spirit. I pray for the Holy Spirit's guidance to make
me a better witness...Amen.

Keep looking up, His grace is sufficient for the day...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus says, "When he, (the Spirit) comes, he will convict the world of guilt in regard to sin and righteousness and judgment: in regard to sin, because men do not believe in Me; in regard to righteousness, because I am going to the Father, where you can see Me no longer, and in regard to judgment, because the prince of this world now stands condemned." (John 16:8-11) NIV
reflection: Jesus tell us that the Holy Spirit has three important tasks, (1) convicting the world of its sin and calling it to repentance, (2) revealing the standard of God's righteousness to anyone who believes, because Christ would no longer be physically present on earth, and (3) demonstrating Christ's judgment over Satan. In vs. 9 according to Jesus, not believing in Him is sin. Christ's death on the cross made a personal relationship with God available to us. When we confess our sin, God declares us righteous and delivers us from judgment for our sins. This country once again needs to listen to the Holy Spirit and confess its sins.
prayer: Dear Lord I thank You for all that Jesus made available to me through His death on the cross. I thank You also for the convicting power of the Holy Spirit. I pray that I would always be sensitive and obedient to the Holy Spirit. Forgive me Lord for any unconfessed sin. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...He who buries his talent is making
a grave mistake. (I Tim. 4:14a)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus says, "When he, (the Spirit) comes, he will convict the world of guilt 
in regard to sin and righteousness and judgment: in regard to sin, because 
men do not believe in Me; in regard to righteousness, because I am going 
to the Father, where you can see Me no longer, and in regard to judgment, 
because the prince of this world now stands condemned. (Jn.16:8-11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus tell us that the Holy Spirit has three important tasks, 
(1) convicting the world of its sin and calling it to repentance, 

(2) revealing the standard of God's righteousness to anyone 
who believes, because Christ would no longer be physically 
present on earth, and 

(3) demonstrating Christ's judgment over Satan...

In vs. 9 according to Jesus, not believing in Him is sin...

Christ's death on the cross made a personal relationship with God available 
to us. When we confess our sin, God declares us righteous and delivers us 
from judgment for our sins...

This country once again needs to listen to the Holy Spirit and confess it's sins...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord I thank You for all that Jesus made available to me
through His death on the cross...I thank You also for the convicting 
power of the Holy Spirit...I pray that I would always be sensitive
and obedient to the Holy Spirit...Forgive me Lord for any unconfessed 
sin...Amen.

Keep looking up, the Lord wishes to have a personal relationship with you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
reflection: Jesus said to the disciples that the Holy Spirit would tell them "about the future" the nature of their mission, the opposition they would face, and the final outcome of their efforts. They did not fully understand these predictions until the Holy Spirit came after Jesus' death and resurrection. The Holy Spirit revealed truths to the disciples that they wrote down in the books that are now the New Testament. The truth into which the Holy Spirit guides us is the truth about Christ. The Spirit also helps us through patient practice to discern right from wrong.
verse: Jesus said to His disciples, "But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come." (John 16:13) NIV
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, once again I thank You for the workings of Your Holy Spirit. Help me to always be patient and quick to listen to his leading and guiding. Forgive me for allowing the busyness of each day to take control of my life. Bless my e-mail buddies today with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...If a care is too small to be turned into a prayer,
it is to small to be made into a burden. (I Pet. 5:7)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus said to His disciples, "But when he the Spirit of truth, comes, 
he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak on his own; he will
speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come." (Jn 16:13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus said to the disciples that the Holy Spirit would tell them "about the future"
the nature of their mission, the opposition they would face, and the final outcome 
of their efforts...

They did not fully understand these predictions until the Holy Spirit came after Jesus'
death and resurrection. The Holy Spirit revealed truths to the disciples that they
wrote down in the books that are now the New Testament...

The truth into which the Holy Spirit guides us is the truth about Christ. The Spirit also 
helps us through patient practice to discern right from wrong...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again I thank You for the workings of Your Holy Spirit.
Help me to always be patient and quick to listen to his leading and guiding. Forgive 
me for allowing the busyness of each day to take control of my life. Bless my e-mail 
buddies today with good health and safety...Amen.

Look up, when you have to little strength to look within...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
